description: Eczema, also known as atopic dermatitis, is a long-term (chronic) inflammatory skin condition that causes dry, itchy, and inflamed skin. It's characterized by recurring rashes and intense itching.
most_likely_cause_of_disease: Genetic predisposition (family history of eczema, asthma, or hay fever)
Defects in the skin barrier function
precautions_we_need_to_take: Avoid known allergens and irritants (e.g., soaps, detergents, fragrances, certain fabrics)
Moisturize skin regularly with fragrance-free emollients
Keep nails short and clean to prevent scratching
Avoid hot showers and baths (lukewarm is better)
Wear loose-fitting clothing made of soft, breathable fabrics
Identify and avoid trigger foods if applicable (food allergies can worsen eczema)
symptoms_of_that_disease: Blisters that may leak fluid and crust over
intense itching that worsens at night
diet_we_need_to_follow: Eliminate or reduce known food allergens if identified (e.g., dairy, eggs, peanuts, soy, wheat)
Increase intake of omega-3 fatty acids (found in fatty fish, flaxseeds, walnuts)
Ensure adequate intake of vitamins and minerals (particularly vitamin D, zinc, and vitamin E)
Hydrate by drinking plenty of water
Consider a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains
affect_of_disease: Disrupted sleep due to nighttime itching
Skin infections (secondary bacterial or viral infections)
Emotional distress due to appearance and itching
